pr_title: Add alphabetical sort criterion to determine the main node in order to have name invariance of a substation

timeline.message:
Add alphabetical sort criterion to determine the main node in order to have name invariance of a substation

Signed-off-by: Slimane AMAR <slimane.amar@rte-france.com>

Add alphabetical sort criterion to determine the main node in order to have name invariance of a substation

Signed-off-by: Slimane AMAR <slimane.amar@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: Use IntStream.range(0, 100) instead of IntStream.iterate(0, i -> i + 1).limit(100)
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
Looking to the code, this algorithm doesn't return the first node in the alphabetic order. I change your unit test like this:
##C 2007.05.01
Test case for UCTE import issue in PowSyBl core package
When multiples VLs with the same nominal voltage are present in a substation, only one is created
contact : slimane.amar@rte-france.com

##N
##ZFR
F1TEST11 1TEST11 1    0 0        0.15546 72.7296 0.00000 0.00000
F1TEST21 1TEST21 1    0 0        0.15546 72.7296 0.00000 0.00000
F1TEST2A 1TEST2A 1    0 0        0.15546 72.7296 0.00000 0.00000
FTESTA11 TESTAP7      0 0        0.00000 0.00000 0.00000 0.00000
FTESTU11 TESTUP7 1-2  0 0        0.00000 0.00000 0.00000 0.00000

##T
F1TEST11 FTESTU11 1 0 380.0 380.0 1186. 0.1280 44.280 0.000000 0.0000   1803 TESTUY771
FTESTA11 FTESTU11 1 0 380.0 380.0 1186. 0.1280 44.280 0.000000 0.0000   1803 TESTAY771

With your proposal, it returns FTESTU11 but the first node in alphabetical order is F1TEST11. I think you have to fix the implementation to be simpler to understand or to explain what you expect.
This is my proposal:

first, extract this lambda to a well named method and replace the sorted + findfirst by a min()
then change the implementation of the lambda:

Prefer the real node rather than an XNODE (line 196-201 of the current implementation)
Prefer the highest voltage level (line 178)
Prefer the first busbar number: numbers before letters (line 181 has to be fixed)
Prefer the first nodeCode : use the alphabetical order
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: In the description above it is the lexicographically greater therefore the last and not the first.
replies.author: SlimaneAmar

replies.bodyText:
This choice is to give preference to a name that does not contain a number or with a right most number.
But it's not necessary.
replies.author: SlimaneAmar

replies.bodyText:
What is the requirements: to have a deterministic order whatever how it is implemented? If it's the case, your proposal wouldn't return the first VL for that example.
A UCTE node code is constituted of:

a geographical spot (2nd-6th character)
a voltage level (7th character)
a busbar code (8th character)

In that case, I propose to change the implementation again to:

get the highest voltage level
get the lower geographical spot (lexicographic order)
get the lower busbar code

Do you agree?
replies.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText:
The only requirement is to generate a name of a susbstation in a deterministic way in order to be able to perform comparison tests of 2 imports.
So i think your fix is a sufficient solution.
replies.author: SlimaneAmar

timeline.message:
Rename the test file (#1573)

Signed-off-by: Slimane AMAR <slimane.amar@rte-france.com>
